problem: What is the value of the expression $[ a-(b-c) ] - [(a-b) - c ]$ when $a = 17$, $b=21$ and $c=5$?
chatgpt_solution: We have that $[ a-(b-c) ] - [(a-b) - c ] = (a-(b-c)) - ((a-b) - c)$. Substituting our given values, we get $(17-(21-5)) - ((17-21) - 5)$. To simplify, we perform the operations inside the parentheses first. So, $17-(21-5) = 17-16 = 1$ and $(17-21) - 5 = -4 - 5 = -9$. Substituting these results back into our original expression, we get $(1) - (-9) = 1-(-9) = 1 + 9 = \boxed{10}$.
